page.title: 11CHESTER-LE-STREET CINEMA
page.content: After the old cinema closed a new one opened in 1981,presenting many good films,but the owner,Mr.J.Sample, decided to close it down before Christmas 1984 because it did not make enough profit.By 1985 rumours were spreading that it was to reopen as a snooker hall.In April 1985 the decision was made to reopen one of the two cinema screens.The entry fee is resonable at Â£0.75 for children and Â£1.50 for adults.However,as more homes acquire video machines the cinema is becoming less popular.By Autumn 1985 a snooker hall will occupy the other half of the cinema as this game has in recent years become very popular due to widespread television coverage.
